org.usfirst.frc.team1736.lib.Calibration

Class CalWrangler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc.team1736.lib.Calibration.CalWrangler

  • public class CalWrangler
extends java.lang.Object
    DESCRIPTION:
    Calibration Wrangler. Manages the full set of calibrations in the software. Can override calibration values based on a .csv file at a specific location on the RIO's filesystem

    Calibration file format:
    calibrationName,value

    Ex:
    ShooterSpeed,3200.5
    Pgain,0.125


    USAGE:
    1. Each calibration will register itself with this static wrangler upon instantiation
    2. At the start of teleop or autonomous, call the loadCalValues() method to update cal values based on .csv file values

    • Method Detail

      • loadCalValues

        public static int loadCalValues()
        Reads from the calibration .csv file and overwrites present calibration values specified. Prints warnings to screen if odd things happen. Will attempt to override any values possible, but on failure will just leave the values at default.
        Returns:
        0 on success, -1 if cal file not found,

      • saveCalValues

        public static int saveCalValues()
        Writes present set of cal values over existing ones on file. Saving will ensure that cal overrides persist over disable/enable cycles. A status box is generated on the webpage for failed or successful overwrites.
        Returns:
        0 on success, -1 on writing errors

      • resetAllCalsToDefault

        public static int resetAllCalsToDefault()
        Resets all registered calibrations back to default values
        Returns:
        0 on success, nonzero on failure

      • register

        public static int register(Calibration cal_in)
        Register a calibration with the wrangler. Registration adds a reference to the calibration to the wrangler so when the wrangler is called upon to update calibration values, it knows which values it should be changing. This function is called automatically by the constructor for calibrations. Unless something very intersting is happening, the user should never have to call it.
        Parameters:
        cal_in - The calibration to add to this wrangler.
        Returns:
        0 on success, nonzero on failure

      • getCalFromName

        public static Calibration getCalFromName(java.lang.String name_in)
        Return a reference to a registered calibration, given its name. Case sensitive.
        Parameters:
        name_in - Name of the calibration to look up.
        Returns:
        Reference to calibration, or null if no registered cal matches the name.
